channel.title: Parents
channel.description:
This isn't necessarily the best topic to talk about on my birthday, but I've been having some issues with my parents recently.
I want to know, are/were your parents over-controlling in a manor?
Ok, so my father thinks that because he brought me into this worlds that his opinion should never be questioned, and if I ever start to argue, he thinks I'm insulting him or calling him stupid. I'm not calling anyone stupid, it's just my own natural reaction to question things and find the most logical solution. He also thinks that he needs to be in control over everything, even the hours I sleep. I don't get why he should have any say in when I sleep, I started going to sleep arround 6 P.M to 3 A.M, then doing any work I had leftover. I did this because the amount of stress both my parents cause is unbearable at this point. I know I live under their roof and in the same way, it's their rules, but they tell me to do things JUST because they said so rather than respecting my opinion as a human being in trying to find a simpler solution.
My mother, like many, is quite a hypocrite. She always says that the opinion of my 'hooligan' friends (even though they are plenty well-behaved I guess you could say) doesn't matter and that I should disregard their opinions. On the other hand, if she is arround her friends she puts everyone to work to make everything clean and spotless, as usual for any guest. The problem starts when I question someones opinion. Lets say that they are talking about something, their jobs maybe, and I say there is a better way to do a certain thing. My mother takes offense to it and punishes me. I'm not saying that their stupid or anything, I'm just trying to help you get shit done faster.
I know I'm making sound like I think that I'm smarter than everyone, besides my peers anyway, but when you live in the middle of the redneck state, that will happen.
So let me once again ask you, are your parents over-bearing or over-controlling?

Rodgerwilco:

So we decide to go swimming in the creek behind my house. We’re in the water and I’ve been nailin her for like 2 minutes and I feel something weird on my nuts. I feel my balls and jump off of her and there is a leach clinched on to my ball sack. Neither one of us knew how to get it off, so we go back to the house and I have to pull out my nuts and let my parents put salt on my balls and remove this fucking leach. As they are removing the leech and my balls are bleeding from the thing sucking my blood, my dad brings up the fact that my cock is greasy and my mom sniffs my cock and says yes he had a rubber on and then have a nice sex talk with me and the gf. This was a little awkward.

hahahhahahahahahhahahahhahhahahahahahahahhahahahahahahhahahahahha

OT: Yeah you’re dad sounds like a cunt, atleast he didn’t try to murder your mum/mom twice with a hammer/knife.

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

krackkid:

Well now I see what you mean o.o That is kind of messed up.

Now you see why I savior the 10 minutes I have alone before he gets home.

h1 sk1ller:

My father is a control freak, and my step mother, last time I saw them about 2 months ago, first time in 4 years they blamed me for having no contact with them, yet they had moved 5 times into different areas and parts of the country, they blame me for problems with my mum and my father when I was only 3, he used to beat me up and stuff :S so yeah, but my mum does try to make me the best I can trying to point me in the right direction so I guess it’s just my father and step mum.

Yeah, my father punishes me for no reason at all on occasion, the sad part is my mother sits by doing nothing about it, as if I had something coming for something they may have foreseen in the 10 minute ride home.

zuppers:

I know this isn’t really the best advice but when my father pushed me I pushed back even harder. Figuratively speaking of course.

I used too, until once he tackled me and got me in a hold and kept saying “do you understand?” I had to hit him to get out of it and that’s kind of scared me because I keep wondering if I did the right thing.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

krackkid:

Well my dad has anger issues to, He often fights with him self in his sleep o.o I mean down to yelling and hitting him self(he has issues). But he doesn’t really try and control everything he says the way he would prefer something done, then if you don’t do it that way he will carry on about it for weeks.

For an example (even though it actually happened): Once he came home saying
dad:“Why isn’t this worksheet done?” (they can check my work online)
me:“Because we’re not allowed to take it home, it’s a quiz”
“Can’t you do anything else?”
“Not really, the internet is down right now”
“I don’t care we need to get this done”
“Well I can’t right now, there’s no internet”
“I don’t give a damn! Now get up and do the fuckin work!”

I missed a day of school from the flu if you were wondering. I needed to get on a certain website to finish it. He then made me sit at a table for 2 hours trying to make me know what we learned the day I missed.

Read full topic

o.o Maybe they think you are trying to out smart them, But like you said I never met em so its hard to tell :/[/quote]
I start it off something like that, many people arround here think they are better than everyone else, so maybe. But you would think my parents would know the type of person that I am. Most of the problem is with my father, he thinks he can control every aspect of everything, and to boot he has anger issues.

[/quote]
I enjoy the hard way of many things too, but how am I supposed to know your personal preference of your way or my way, I never watch you do it, but if I think you may like my way better, why not make the suggestion?[/quote]Well how do you start off the suggestion, Like “Maybe you should try…” or “If you did…”

o.o Maybe they think you are trying to out smart them, But like you said I never met em so its hard to tell

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

That is a little tricky I suppose, But maybe you should try to explain to your mom it, then she could tell them. But I do understand how you feel there is many times where I will sit and watch my brothers, mom, or dad do something and I already have easier ways to do it. But I was always taught not to tell them what to do. So I normally wait for them to ask or I will just start laughing.

and there are some people even my self who prefer the hard way of doing things, because that’s by the book. Which a lot of people follow.

Read full topic

item.title: Parents
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:4, topic:424317”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=526969.msg3840140#msg3840140 date=1323157929]

You are very disrespectful.

How? I still respect them, but they don’t respect my opinion. I’m the type of person who points something out if somethings wrong.
[/quote]I understand that part, but some times it best to keep your opinion to your self.

You said “Lets say that they are talking about something, their jobs maybe, and I say there is a better way to do a certain thing.” That is not your conversation to be in.
You shouldn’t argue also. Should be yes sir and yes ma’am.
Also it seems like he should control your sleep hours, Because 6pm to 3am…That’s not very good sleeping time.[/quote]
I know this, but I’m in the conversation, they drag me into it by asking me any random thing, Probably not the best example though. Besides, if you could do something in 10 minutes that you usually spend an hour doing, wouldn’t you want to know? Sorry for trying to make for life easier then. Not the right place for the conversation, I admit, but tell me this, when else should I tell them if I never see them.

About my sleep: I sleep their to actually avoid my parents, they cause WAY to much stress, like I don’t get enough in my every day life.

Read full topic

item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

This isn’t necessarily the best topic to talk about on my birthday, but I’ve been having some issues with my parents recently.

Ok, so my father thinks that because he brought me into this worlds that his opinion should never be questioned, and if I ever start to argue, he thinks I’m insulting him or calling him stupid.
